org.casa.synthproxy.ide

Class CycleThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.casa.synthproxy.CommandSender
        • org.casa.synthproxy.ide.CycleThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class CycleThread
extends CommandSender
    This class handles the action cycling mechanism of CASASynthProxy IDE.
    Author:
    Daniel Parra Tucunduva

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

      private Component activeComponent
      This stores the currently active component in the screen (painted yellow)

      CycleThread instance
      private static List<Component> level1ComponentList
      Level 1 component list - This is the equivalent to commandGroups that we have in the configuration

      Level 2 component map - This is the equivalent to commands that we have in the configuration.
      private Component selectedComponent
      This stores the currently selected component in the screen (i.e., the component that the user selected by a input button)

      Flag to signal that we need to stop sycling through components

      • cycleThread

        private static CycleThread cycleThread
        CycleThread instance

      • level1ComponentList

        private static List<Component> level1ComponentList
        Level 1 component list - This is the equivalent to commandGroups that we have in the configuration

      • level2ComponentMap

        private static HashMap<Component,List<Component>> level2ComponentMap
        Level 2 component map - This is the equivalent to commands that we have in the configuration. Each command is stored in a command group

        This stores the currently active component in the screen (painted yellow)

        public Component getActiveComponent()

        Set the active component - That is the component that is painted yellow in the screen
        Parameters:

        public Component getSelectedComponent()

      • setSelectedComponent

        public void setSelectedComponent(Component selectedComponent)
        Set the Currently selected component in the screen (i.e., the component that the user selected by a input button)
        Parameters:
        selectedComponent - Currently selected component in the screen (i.e., the component that the user selected by a input button)

      • getInstance

        public static CycleThread getInstance()
        This will give you a cycle thread instance. Each time a cycle thread start cyclin (and for that a thread is created), it cannot stat again, as JAVA only allows an object to turn into a thread once. So, if it is not alive or null, create a new one and return it.
        Returns:
        Instance of the Cycling thread

      • addRootComponent

        public void addRootComponent(Component component)
        Adds a component to the first level (command groups)
        Parameters:
        component - Component mapping the command group

      • addSecondLevelComponent

        public void addSecondLevelComponent(Component rComponent,
                                    Component component)
        Adds a second level component - That would be a command inside a command group
        Parameters:
        rComponent - Component mapped to the command group
        component - Component mapped to a command

      • startCycling

        public void startCycling()
        Start cycling process. This will start the thread in this instance, which will issue a command to switch the TV set to the selection screen and then start highlighting command groups and command so the user can select those.

      • selectionRequested

        public void selectionRequested()
        This method is called when a selection was requested by CASAActuator. It will check if a cycling process is running and then try to perform the selecion. If the selection is at the group level (level 1 component), a new phase of the cycling process starts, through the commands. If cycling is already at the second level, it will try to issue the selected command to CASAActuator

      • run

        public void run()
        Main thread method. This will actually handle the cycling process
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread

      • waitForAction

        private void waitForAction()
        Standard waiting time between groups/actions cycling

      • stopCycling

        private void stopCycling()
        Flags this thread to stop cycling actions.
